author: Jordan Gitterman
title: Global Parity Valuation Engine
description: Nearly every exchange is based on faulty values making them unfair. Markets need a new baseline and method to deliver fair value for all.

assessments.note: The assessment of BHN is definitely a huge potential instrument for developing nations to attain such information as far as market goes, but the scope of the concept lacks clarity on how it will be usable to an individual who could benefit from the project objective. More clarity on how its interface with the common user and how it can reach the target population in question.

I understand what you're after but a) I don't think this is needed and b) the data you are looking to collect is already available in other sources:

https://www.numbeo.com/cost-of-living/

This proposal does address the issue of how can application developers drive adoption of Cardano in 2021? The question of whether this proposal is submitting a "Quality Dapp and integration that will increase utility & adoption of Cardano"  remains open in my mind. I am not convinced by the proposal as it seems a worthy goal, but many issues can be found:

- if the proposed index, a measure to be used as a baseline of value, is such a valuable idea - why hasn't it been developed yet.

This proposal not only looks at the new idea as a concept, but also proposes to integrate it to a blockchain. However, many arguments are laid out that seem to be partly wishful thinking:

-  The market will have confidence that standardized prices for BHN commodities are accurately established.
- Producers can use the Item Banc Engine's data to determine where the most profitable markets are to export their products, to properly hedge their production and inventories. - - The financial markets will have a better way to value currencies.

These are claims with far-reaching consequences for this project, but are based on suppositions and as such I am not sure about the "Quality integration" part of the proposal.

This is an interesting idea, to create an index pegged to real world data that is constantly updated by users. But to me it still sounds like a centralized solution that is only using Cardano as a reward system.
I believe in the vision of this project's potential, a little ambivalent about how it can be used in a system effectively is my personal concern in deploying this wonderful tool.
I would suggest a bit more research. Maybe you could join another like-minded team.

The plan is global, the plan involves 100 Basic Need Items and will require great standardization efforts across the globe and must rely on the honesty of participants. It presupposes their interest for this token.

There are many unknowns and I am not sure that the presented experience and plan indicate it is likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.

The proposed budget is a lump sum for a MVP - without a clear definition of the MVP - and a more detailed breakdown into manageable pieces with associated funding would have made the task of judging the proposal as highly likely to be implemented - easier.

This proposal is technically challenging to implement and would likely required a team of developers. It's not clear what experience the proposer has in order to implement this solution, specially on the technical side. The plan is very loosely described, but need a lot more detail specially on technical implementation

I agree with the challenge posed and the solution detailed. BHN should be definitely defined in ways that it can deliver accurate standardization across the market. There are some commodities although that fall under subjective values rather than basic need items like shoes, clothes among other things which value varies not because of technology and materials but other aspect of their use like aesthetical value.  I think if we can narrow the scope to energy, access to medicine, sustenance, education, water and information(financial included).
The plan is fine but I just don't think this is a problem worth solving.

I do not think that the proposal provides sufficient information to assess how feasible it is. I think it is an ambitious and laudable idea per se, but there is an enormous chasm for every project to go from idea to implementation - in this project it seems the gap is very large. As such, I am not sure it is able to effectively address the challenge.
There's no roadmap for implementation, no KPI's or success criteria and no budget breakdown

solution: For an engine to record basic human need transaction's data the world over to create an index, a measure to be used as a baseline of value.
experience: Vast international experience in direct trade, commodities, natural resources and spawned the first global parity valuation engine.
